Metadata.Title: Unauthorized Substitution of Keys Is Prevented
Metadata.DirectLink: Unauthorized Substitution of Keys Is Prevented
Metadata.Author: Serge Batchilo, Jason Taylor, Joe Basirico

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • PCI DSS Requirement 3.6.7

What to Check For

Key management procedures should be implemented to prevent unauthorized key substitution.

Why

Unauthorized key substitution means that an attacker can substitute one of the authorized keys and gain access to sensitive information without raising alarm.

How to Check

Check the key management procedures in the information security policy to make sure there are provisions for preventing unauthorized key substitution.

How to Fix

Make a table of authorized keys (known as a keystore) and use only those keys for encryption. Whenever changes are made to the table of keys, make sure the changes are authorized. Document the implementation of the key table and the update mechanism in the key management procedures in the information security policy.

Additional Resources

  • For more information about key management procedures, please see http://csrc.nist.gov  
  • For more information about designing and documenting key management procedures, please see http://www.net-security.org/article.php?id=1185
